thread.title: Google Self-Driving Car Unit Accuses Uber of Using Stolen Technology - The New York Times
thread.title_full: Google Self-Driving Car Unit Accuses Uber of Using Stolen Technology - The New York Times

author: Daisuke Wakabayashi
title: Google Self-Driving Car Unit Accuses Uber of Using Stolen Technology - The New York Times
text: OPEN Graphic “Otto and Uber have taken Waymo’s intellectual property so that they could avoid incurring the risk, time, and expense or independently developing their own technology. Ultimately, this calculated theft reportedly netted Otto employees over half a billion dollars and allowed Uber to revive a stalled program, all at Waymo’s expense,” the company said in the filing. Uber did not respond to requests for comment. In its filing, Waymo said it was inadvertently copied on an email from one of its suppliers with drawings of Uber’s circuit board design for its lidar technology, a portmanteau of “light” and “radar” that are laser-based sensors used in self-driving cars. Waymo said Uber’s design bore “a striking resemblance” to its proprietary and highly secret design and infringed on Waymo’s patents.
